Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black (mostly worn) with traces of lotus flower in added red and white; exterior: painted decoration consisting of bull's horn to right and part of lion's head to left; part of pendant roundel as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding the subject matter, see British Museum 1888,0601.471.a.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 264, no. 566, pl. 71)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 33, no. 29, pl. XVII)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0606) (phase 2)
